title: 70 Best Meal Prep Recipes - Easy Meal Prep Ideas
description: Let us take the guesswork out of prepping.
body: <style type="text/css">#sidepanel{transform:translateX(0);visibility:visible;content-visibility:auto;}@media (max-width:425px){#sidepanel{width:7rem;max-width:7rem;}#sidepanel .nav-item,#sidepanel .nav-item a,#sidepanel footer a,#sidepanel div a,#sidepanel a span{font-size:10px;}#sidepanel ul,#sidepanel div{padding:0;margin:0;}#sidepanel button{display:none;}}</style>SearchMy RecipesSubscribeMembership BenefitsRecipesMealsHolidaysFood TrendsNewsKitchen Tips & ToolsAll VideosAbout UsNewsletterDelish ShopFollowOther EditionsYour Privacy ChoicesPrivacy NoticeTerms Of UseSkip to ContentRecipesDinnersSpring RecipesKitchen TipsNewsSubscribesign inSearchLemon Blueberry DessertsSpring SaladsCopycat Recipe IdeasBrunch RecipesSpring DinnersMeals & CookingRecipe HeadquartersThese 70 Meal Prep Recipes Help Me Feel Like My Life's In Order (Even When It's Not)These 70 Meal Prep Recipes Help Me Feel Like My Life's In Order (Even When It's Not)Let us take the guesswork out of prepping.By Camille LowderUpdated: Jan 21, 2025Save ArticlePHOTO: JULIA GARTLAND; FOOD STYLING: BARRETT WASHBURNEYes, meal prepping sounds like a genius idea, right? It saves time and money, takes the guesswork out of what to eat, and can lead to making healthier choices over time. The trouble is deciding what to make. Itâ€™s got to be interesting enough that youâ€™ll want to eat it over and over again, easy enough that it can be prepped in one go, and simple enough that the idea of prepping it isnâ€™t overwhelming. Phew! Good thing weâ€™re up to the challenge, for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Check out our 70 best meal prep recipes for ideasâ€”youâ€™ll become a master at it in no time.If youâ€™re unfamiliar, the idea of meal prepping is just what it sounds likeâ€”making multiple meals ahead of time rather than cooking each meal individually. Itâ€™s not a novel concept (hello, leftovers!), but it can be tricky to plan to do it for all of your meals. To start, youâ€™re going to want to get some good meal prep-ready containers. The goal is to make you more organized, not less, so we definitely recommend getting a matching set.Once youâ€™ve got those ready, get to prepping! We recommend starting with a base like pasta or rice (try it in a rice cooker to make it extra easy on yourself). Then get in some veggies and legumes, like our sweet potato salad, our Mediterranean chickpea salad, or our TikTok green goddess salad. Next up should be protein, like our slow cooker Korean beef, tofu scramble (not just for breakfast!), or sheet-pan sausage & vegetables. Speaking of, we've got a number of other recipes that include nearly everything youâ€™ll need (including protein, carbs, and veggies) too, like our BBQ sheet-pan chicken, our sheet-pan garlicky shrimp & veggies, or our Thai-inspired basil beef. Just add something to go with them, and youâ€™ll be all set. Check out our halal cart-style cauliflower bowls, our avocado breakfast bowls, our copycat Chipotle burrito bowls, or our salmon quinoa bowls to see examples of what a perfect meal prepped dish looks like, then get creative in making your own.It should be noted, SO many of our recipes are already meal prep-ready (we love making things easier for you in the kitchen). Check out our favorite one-pan meals, our sheet-pan dinners, our slow-cooker recipes, our top quick dinners, and our best air fryer recipes too.1Low-Carb Turkey Gyro BowlsPHOTO: RACHEL VANNI; FOOD STYLING: ADRIENNE ANDERSONWith tender spiced meat, crunchy fresh veggies, tzatziki, and chewy pita, it's not hard to see why gyros are so globally beloved. Inspired by this popular sandwich, we created this healthy but hearty bowl that's perfect for a light dinner.Get the Low-Carb Turkey Gyro Bowls recipe.2Freezer BurritosPHOTO: ANDREW BUI; FOOD STYLING: BROOKE CAISONTo make these easy prepped burritos, ground beef gets simmered in spiced tomato sauce, then layered into a flour tortilla with refried beans, rice, and a blend of cheese. Though the goal is to get these wrapped and in the freezer for a future meal, we wonâ€™t judge if you eat one right away. ðŸ˜‰Get the Freezer Burritos recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below3Copycat Egg McMuffinPHOTO: RYAN LIEBE; FOOD STYLING: SAM SENEVIRATNEWhen the McDonaldâ€™s drive-through window is closed, you can rely on this easy-to-follow copycat recipe for backup. All you need are some English muffins, Canadian bacon, American cheese, and eggs. You might actually enjoy the process of making these too; meal prep them for the morning commute or pack them for the kids to eat on their way to school. Get the Copycat Egg McMuffin recipe. 4Blended Overnight OatsPHOTO: JULIA GARTLAND; FOOD STYLING: SAM SENEVIRATNEThese blended overnight oats started to pop up on our TikTok feeds, and we needed to see if they lived up to the hype. And did they ever! Blending the ingredients together gives the finished recipe a thick, almost pudding-like texture. Because these are peanut butter oats, a cap of melted chocolate felt important here. (And chocolate is absolutely a breakfast food. See: pain au chocolat.) Sliced bananas, crunchy peanuts, cacao nibs, and more honey complete this magical breakfast moment.Get the Blended Overnight Oats recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below5BulgogiPHOTO: ERIK BERNSTEIN; FOOD STYLING: MARY RUPPExtremely popular at Western Korean BBQ joints, beef bulgogi is deeply delicious thanks to its signature marinade, which both tenderizes the meat and infuses each bite with complex flavor. This dish isnâ€™t difficult to make, but does take some time: make it on Sunday, then enjoy the fruits of your labor all week long.Get the Bulgogi recipe.6Greek Salad Cottage Cheese BowlsPHOTO: RACHEL VANNI; FOOD STYLING: ADRIENNE ANDERSONIt wouldnâ€™t be a Mediterranean menu without a Greek salad in some form or anotherâ€”these cottage cheese bowls fit the bill. Packed with protein, nutrient-rich vegetables, and healthy fats (not to mention a whole lot of flavor), theyâ€™re the perfect anytime vegetarian meal.Get the Greek Salad Cottage Cheese Bowls recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below7Salmon Quinoa BowlsPHOTO: RACHEL VANNI; FOOD STYLING: ADRIENNE ANDERSONThis recipe is not only a simple, quick dinner (ready in 20 minutes!), but itâ€™s a texture loverâ€™s paradise. Quinoa is the base for our bowl, setting the stage for fresh arugula, thin slices of cucumber, tender, buttery salmon, and a homemade creamy dill and yogurt dressing. Get the Salmon Quinoa Bowls recipe.8Cosmic Brownie Protein BitesPHOTO: JULIA GARTLAND; FOOD STYLING: MAKINZE GORENeed a little sweet something at 4 p.m. to carry you until dinner? Cosmic brownie protein bites are here for you. Made with a handful of pantry ingredients plus your favorite protein powder, these simple stir-together protein bites will become as integral to your adult snacking life as their namesake was to your childhood.Get the Cosmic Brownie Protein Bites recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below9BBQ Protein BowlsPHOTO: JULIA GARTLAND; FOOD STYLING: BARRETT WASHBURNEWith BBQ chicken, corn, an easy slaw, rice, and pickles, these grain bowls are a protein-packed dinner that's meal prep gold. Once you prep the rice ahead of time, these bowls will only take 15 minutes to cook and assemble!Get the BBQ Protein Bowls recipe.10Sushi Sandwich (Onigirazu)PHOTO: ANDREW BUI; FOOD STYLING: TIFFANY SCHLEIGHInspired by the popular Japanese onigirazu, this is like a cross between sushi and a sandwich. We filled ours with spicy salmon, seasoned sushi rice, cucumber, pickled cabbage, carrot, and avocadoâ€”then wrapped it in nori to make it extra portable. Serve it with plenty of the sriracha-soy mayo on the side!Get the Sushi Sandwich (Onigirazu) recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below11Coconut Chickpea & Sweet Potato CurryPHOTO: ANDREW BUI; FOOD STYLING: TAYLOR ANN SPENCERIf you're craving a hearty and comforting dinner that's also vegan, look no further. This curry is bursting with ingredients inspired by chana masala, and is so chock-full of flavor that you won't miss the meat.Get the Coconut Chickpea & Sweet Potato Curry recipe.12Creamy Peanut-Lime Chicken With NoodlesPHOTO: ANDREW BUI; FOOD STYLING: BROOKE CAISONWho can resist rice noodles bathed in an abundance of sweet and creamy peanut sauce? The trick here is getting everything in order before starting to cook. The prep actually takes longer than the cooking, but once it's behind you, the dish comes together in a snap!Get the Creamy Peanut-Lime Chicken With Noodles recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below13Thai-Inspired Basil Beef BowlsPHOTO: RACHEL VANNI; FOOD STYLING: BARRETT WASHBURNEPad krapow is Thailandâ€™s most popular stir-fry dish, and it's perfect for meal prepping. In it, saucy ground meat is tossed with sliced bell peppers, spicy chiles, fresh, sweet basil, and served over steaming rice with a runny fried egg for a filling and wallet-friendly meal.Get the Thai-Inspired Basil Beef Bowls recipe.14BBQ Sheet-Pan ChickenPHOTO: ROCKY LUTEN; FOOD STYLING: MAKINZE GOREHere's an easy sheet-pan dinner featuring juicy chicken, loads of sweetâ€“smoky flavor, and plenty of vegetables to complete the meal. Make it once and mix it up with different grains to enjoy it all week long!Get the BBQ Sheet-Pan Chicken recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below15Sheet-Pan Garlicky Shrimp & VeggiesPHOTO: ERIK BERNSTEIN; FOOD STYLING: MAKINZE GOREThis recipe combines well-seasoned shrimp with red bell peppers, broccoli, and onions for a quick and easy dinner ready in a little more than 30 minutes. Not only is it so simple to throw together, it's extremely versatile. This dinner is all about easeâ€”make it work for you. Get the Sheet-Pan Garlicky Shrimp & Veggies recipe.16Jollof RicePHOTO: RACHEL VANNI; FOOD STYLING: TAYLOR ANN SPENCERThis rice is filling, flavorful, and truly a standout thanks to a balance of heat, sweet (from the tomatoes and peppers) and spice profile. Plus, itâ€™s not too spicyâ€”this is the rice you can enjoy with a variety of different proteins an veggies, so make a big batch!Get the Jollof Rice recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below17Slow-Cooker Korean BeefPHOTO: ROCKY LUTEN; FOOD STYLING: MAKINZE GOREThis is not a drill: If you toss a pot roast (we went for bottom round roast, which doesn't break the bank) in the slow-cooker with a bunch of spices and soy sauce, you'll have killer Korean beef for dinner!Get the Slow-Cooker Korean Beef recipe.18Hummus Bowl With Spiced LambPHOTO: RACHEL VANNI; FOOD STYLING: ADRIENNE ANDERSONFor this recipe, creamy hummus is topped with spiced ground lamb, onions, fresh herbs, and some pickled veggies add a bright pop of flavor and color. Make everything ahead of time, then toss it all together with some pita (for scooping!) for an easy, tasty meal with minimal effort.Get the Hummus Bowl With Spiced Lamb recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below19Roast ChickenPHOTO: ROCKY LUTEN; FOOD STYLING: BROOKE CAISONThe steps to make this chicken are simple: You season the bird (just salt & pepper!), then roast it at high heat until the skin is bronzed and crisp and the flesh juicy. Use it anywhere you'd use a rotisserie chickenâ€”the options are endless!Get the Roast Chicken recipe.20Mexican RicePHOTO: KATE JORDAN; FOOD STYLING: BROOKE CAISONFrequently served with refried beans at Tex-Mex restaurants, Mexican rice can often be pushed to the side (literally). We think thatâ€™s criminalâ€”when made right, Mexican rice can be a fluffy, flavor-packed side that upgrades everything itâ€™s added to, from grain bowls to taco dinners and everything in between.Get the Mexican Rice recipe.Watch NextÂ Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowWildly Delicious Weeknight DinnersEnchilada CasseroleCauliflower TacosChicken FajitasCacio E Pepe ChickenAdvertisement - Continue Reading BelowPork Dumpling BowlsGreek Orzo SaladCheesy Taco Bake82 Simple Spring DinnersLemon Asparagus Pasta21 Recipes Meghan Markle Would Approve OfChicken Shawarma BowlsChicken & Broccoli CasseroleAdvertisement - Continue Reading BelowNewsletterSubscribeManage SubscriptionAbout UsDelish Test KitchenMedia KitCommunity GuidelinesAdvertise With UsDelish Shop Product SupportOther Hearst SubscriptionsDelish Unlimited Membership SupportTurn off Web NotificationsA Part of Hearst Digital MediaWe may earn commission from links on this page, but we only recommend products we back.Â©2025 Hearst Magazine Media, Inc. Phew! Good thing weâ€™re up to the challenge, for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Check out our 70 best meal prep recipes for ideasâ€”youâ€™ll become a master at it in no time.If youâ€™re unfamiliar, the idea of meal prepping is just what it sounds likeâ€”making multiple meals ahead of time rather than cooking each meal individually. Itâ€™s not a novel concept (hello, leftovers!), but it can be tricky to plan to do it for all of your meals. To start, youâ€™re going to want to get some good meal prep-ready containers. The goal is to make you more organized, not less, so we definitely recommend getting a matching set.Once youâ€™ve got those ready, get to prepping! We recommend starting with a base like pasta or rice (try it in a rice cooker to make it extra easy on yourself). Then get in some veggies and legumes, like our sweet potato salad, our Mediterranean chickpea salad, or our TikTok green goddess salad. Next up should be protein, like our slow cooker Korean beef, tofu scramble (not just for breakfast!), or sheet-pan sausage \u0026 vegetables. Speaking of, we've got a number of other recipes that include nearly everything youâ€™ll need (including protein, carbs, and veggies) too, like our BBQ sheet-pan chicken, our sheet-pan garlicky shrimp \u0026 veggies, or our Thai-inspired basil beef.
